title: Broomhead Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Western tip of Broomhead Reservoir. The head of the lake from Broomhead Bridge.

images.title: Roger May / Broomhead Dam, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Splendid castellated pump house on the dam at Broomhead reservoir. Looking south across the dam.

images.title: Steve F [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Another autumn view of the dam tower.

images.title: Steve F, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The spillway at the eastern end close to More Hall Reservoir.

images.title: Roger May / Broomhead Walk
images.caption: Broomhead Walk. Entrance to the walkway around the reservoir, from Yewtrees Lane.

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / View from Walker Edge
images.caption: View from Walker Edge. This elevated spot is located south of the lake. It provides fine views down to the water.

images.title: Footbridge in the woods west of Ewden Village by John Slater, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footbridge in the woods west of Ewden Village

description: Enjoy an easy circular walk around this reservoir in South Yorkshire's Ewden Valley near Stocksbridge. There's a nice footpath running around the perimeter of the water for just over 2 miles. You can enjoy excellent views across the water to the Peak District countryside and woodland. Start the walk from the small parking area on the southern side of the water. It's located just off New Road near Fox Hill Wood. From here you can pick up the signed footpath to take you around the lake. The reservoir is located a short walk from More Hall Reservoir so you can easily extend your walk here. Also nearby is Wharncliffe Woods and Grenoside Woods where you can pick up the long distance Trans Pennine Trail .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The little village of Bolsterstone is just a short distance north of the reservoir. Here you'll find the Castle Inn which is a typical English village pub. The friendly pub does a great Sunday lunch and is likely to have plenty of other walkers there. It's dog friendly and can be found at postcode S36 3ZB for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The reservoir and surrounding woods are a nice place for a dog walk. The Castle Inn in mentioned above is also dog friendly and you're bound to see other owners there or at the reservoir on a fine day.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Stocksbridge Walk takes you to Moor Hall and Broomhead Reservoirs from the nearby town. For more walking ideas in the area see the Peak District Walks page.

display_address: New Road, Bradfield, Bolsterstone, Sheffield, South Yorkshire, England, S36 4ZD, United Kingdom
